text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Addie a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Cape Town
South Africa today I'm going to show you
how to migrate on my SQL database to a
new Amazon Aurora my secret compatible
Edition DB cluster using Amazon simple
storage service let's get started
restoring my SQL database to a new
Aurora mic secret compatible DB cluster
typically involves three steps backing
up the mySQL database using picona extra
backup utility
uploading the backup files to an Amazon
S3 bucket and finally importing the
database files from Amazon S3 to a new
Aurora MySQL DB cluster
to install a MySQL backup to Amazon S3
the backup must be done with the kuna
extra backup utility
after logging in to the AWS Management
console navigate to the Amazon elastic
compute Cloud console
confirm the IP or its name of the ec2
instance hosting the mySQL database and
then connect to it using SSH
next download and install the pekuna
expert backup utility from the pecano
website for my SQL 5.7 migration you
must use pecuna extra backup 2.4
for early my SQL versions use peculine
x-ray backup 2.3 or 2.4
in this video we will be backing up my
sequel 5.7 database this means that we
will be installing pecuna extra backup
bitcoinx for backup 2.4 it's now
downloaded and I will be installing
using Yom
the next step is to backup the database
we must specify the target directory
where the backup files will be created
we will be backing up to the on-premise
S3 restore backup directory using the
stream option to have the backup split
into multiple XP stream files there is
also the option to backup the files
using the gzip or tar compression
options
the backup step is now complete and we
can see the files created in the Target
directory
it's important to note that Aurora MySQL
doesn't restore everything from your
database
it is a best practice to save the
database schema and values for items
such as user accounts functions stored
procedures and time zone information
from your Source mySQL database and then
add them to your restored over MySQL
cluster after it is created now that the
database backup is complete we're ready
to upload the files generated to Amazon
S3 on the AWS Management console let's
navigate to Amazon S3
I will be creating a bucket for this
upload the Amazon S3 buckets must be in
the same region as the Aurora might
sequel DB cluster that you will be
creating
now that we have a bucket I will create
a folder
it needs to all the backup files to be
uploaded
we're ready to upload the backup files
to the S3 buckets I will be uploading
the files from the command line using
the AWS s3cp command to recursively copy
the backup folder from the target
directory to Amazon S3 buckets
to database files are now completely
uploaded and we can view the contents of
the S3 buckets
the final step is to import the database
files from the Amazon S3 bucket to a new
overall MySQL DB cluster to restore an
Amazon over remote SQL DB cluster from
files on an Amazon S3 bucket follow
these steps from the AWS Management
console open the Amazon relational
database service console
in the top right corner of the Amazon
RDS console choose the AWS region where
you want to create your DB cluster
choose the same AWS region as the Amazon
S3 bucket that contains your database
backup
in the navigation pane choose databases
and then choose restore from S3
the create database by restoring for
Mastery page appears on the S3
destination choose the S3 bucket that
contains the backup files
for S3 folder part prefix enter file
path prefix for the files stored in your
Amazon S3 buckets
if you didn't specify prefix then RDS
creates your DB instance using all of
the files and folders in the root folder
of the S3 buckets if you do specify
prefix then RDS creates your DB instance
using the files and folders and the S3
Pockets were the parts for the file
begins with specified prefix under
engine options for engine type choose
Amazon Aurora
for version choose the aromaite SQL
engine version for your restore DB
instance
for IEM rule you can choose an existing
AWS identity and access management rule
you can also have a new IM rule created
for you by choosing create a new role
choose settings for your DB cluster such
as the DB cluster identifier and the
login credentials
customize additional settings for your
Aurora MySQL DB clusters needed
choose create database to launch your
Aurora DB instance
the restart process is now complete and
the cluster is available we can now
connect to the cluster within my SQL
client to confirm that the database is
correctly restored so now you know how
to migrate on my SQL database to a new
over my SQL DB cluster using Amazon S3
for more information on restoring the
mySQL database to a new over MySQL DB
cluster please refer to the
documentation Link in the video
description
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
